title: Bug 11314: Replace package name fragments should always be smaller
OB: When entering package name fragments in the 'Replace package name fragments with:' field in the preferences (Java Work in progress), observed behavior is that when 'com.ibm.foobar' is entered, it gets replaced with 'co~.ib~.foobar'.
EB: The expected behavior is that package name compression should only replace a fragment if the compressed name is actually smaller. In the given example, 'com.' should not be replaced since 'co~.' is of the same length and contains less information.
SR:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Open the preferences in the Java Work in progress environment.
2. Navigate to the 'Replace package name fragments with:' field.
3. Enter 'com.ibm.foobar'.
4. Observe that the replacement is 'co~.ib~.foobar'.
